question_text:
Question 61. 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
MSQ (1M)
Question ID: 8232513115
Choose the correct choice(s) regarding the following propositional logic assertion S:
S: ((P ^ Q) → R) ((P ^ Q) → 4 (Q → R))
(A)
 S is a contradiction
(B)
 S is a tautology
(C)
 The antecedent of S is equal to consequent of S (doubtful)
(D)
 Neither tautology nor contradiction
explanation_text:
Sol. 
Antecedent (X): (PQ)’ + R ==> P’ + Q’ + R --------- 1
Consequent (Y): ((PQ)’ + (Q’ + R)) ==> (P’ + Q’) + Q’ + R ==> P’ + Q’ + Q’ + R ==> P’ + Q’ + R -
------2
Because Antecedent and Consequent are returning same expression, therefore X 
→
 Y, will be 
Tautology because X and Y are coming out to be same. For example
A
→
A ==> A’ + A ==> 1
